response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (18 years old)", "high", "Young age is associated with higher impulsivity and likelihood of recidivism."],
    ["Race (identifies as Black)", "medium", "Systemic factors and potential societal biases may contribute to risk, though race itself is not a causal factor."],
    ["Arrest History (1 arrest, no conviction)", "medium", "A prior arrest may indicate behavioral issues, but the lack of conviction reduces severity."],
    ["Education (no high school diploma or GED)", "high", "Low educational attainment is strongly linked with limited opportunities and increased risk."],
    ["Employment (held 1 job in the year)", "medium", "Limited employment history can reflect economic instability, contributing to recidivism risk."],
    ["Substance Use (no drug use in past four years)", "low", "Absence of recent drug use is a protective factor against recidivism."],
    ["Mental Health (no recent depressive symptoms)", "low", "Lack of reported depression indicates fewer immediate mental health issues impacting risk."],
    ["Family Background (lived with biological mother in a household of 5 in an urban area)", "medium", "Urban environment and family structure may contribute to exposure to crime, but context is mixed."],
    ["Religious Belief (considers that God has nothing to do with his life)", "medium", "Lack of religiosity can indicate fewer social support systems and protective moral frameworks."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: Young age is associated with higher impulsivity and likelihood of recidivism.
Systemic factors and potential societal biases may contribute to risk, though race itself is not a causal factor.
A prior arrest may indicate behavioral issues, but the lack of conviction reduces severity.
Education (no high school diploma or GED)
Low educational attainment is strongly linked with limited opportunities and increased risk.
Limited employment history can reflect economic instability, contributing to recidivism risk.
Substance Use (no drug use in past four years)
Absence of recent drug use is a protective factor against recidivism.
Lack of reported depression indicates fewer immediate mental health issues impacting risk.
Family Background (lived with biological mother in a household of 5 in an urban area)
Urban environment and family structure may contribute to exposure to crime, but context is mixed.
Religious Belief (considers that God has nothing to do with his life)
Lack of religiosity can indicate fewer social support systems and protective moral frameworks.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is an 18-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 7 inches and weighs 140 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 5, in an urban area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
